Description: Body fragment of body of Clazomenian or East Greek black figure painted pottery amphora or hydria. Scales containing white drops. Two purple stripes on the dark area below the panel.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 11
Curator's comments: Findspot number "11" scratched on the back of the fragment. Belongs with BM GR1888,0208.79.c as part of the same vessel; fragment BM GR1888,0208.79.b is from a lower part of the vessel than fragment c. Philadelphia E.147.38, with similar scales, may be from the same pot. BSA xlvii, 143, n. 102-no. 11 (and no. 11a)
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (pl. GB 590, 30)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 113)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.207)
